alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:42PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 241 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Iron Mountain, or 26 miles northeast of Laramie, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
